org.superfuntime.chatty.chat

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.superfuntime.chatty.chat.User

  • public abstract class User
extends Object
    Represents a single user on a chat protocol.

    Every bot implementation should extend this class to provide functionality.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User()

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayName

        public abstract String getDisplayName()
        Gets the display (human-friendly) name of the user
        Returns:
        The display name of the user

      • getUniqueIdentifier

        public abstract String getUniqueIdentifier()
        Gets the unique identifier of this user. This does not have to be human-friendly, but it has to be unique to this specific user and change as little as possible over time.

        The identifier should include the name of the chat protocol this user belongs to.

        Returns:
        The unique identifier

      • getProfile

        public final Profile getProfile()
        Gets the user's profile. If the user has no profile, a blank one will be created, but not saved in the user's database!

        The user must create a profile for themselves with a username and password (see PermissionManager.createUserProfile(User, String, String)).

        Returns:
        The user's profile

      • hasProfile

        public final boolean hasProfile()
        Gets if this user has a registered profile.
        Returns:
        true if the user has a profile, false otherwise.

      • setProfile

        public void setProfile(Profile profile)
        Sets the user's profile
        Parameters:
        profile - The profile to set to
